The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop is:

`id_value = arr[d]->arr[k]`

where `d` is the current index of the array and `k` is the index of the target.

This invariant proves the partial correctness of the program because it ensures that `id_value` is updated correctly based on the current state of the array and the target index. It also ensures that the loop continues to iterate until it finds the target.
